info.name: Why #define ZERO (min(iFrame,0))
info.description: Why do people use "#define ZERO (min(iFrame,0))" instead of 0 (usually in for loop)?  This shader proves iFrame is never negative (at least in terms of the bounds of this test). Force the compiler to do something? Time delay?  What's the reason to use it?
